title: Travel Counsellors' group bookings in spotlight after sales take off
text:
Travel Counsellors is to continue pushing its corporate group bookings after doubling the number of them made this year. 
The company said an average of eight corporate bookings were confirmed every month this year. 
The bookings were helped by the company’s in-house groups department, which supports agents in putting together corporate bookings such as incentive trips, meetings, team building exercises, conferences and exhibitions. 
Commercial director Kirsten Hughes said at the recent ﻿Business Travel mini conference: “There is an enormous opportunity for us to grow our group bookings sector and support you in creating bespoke and tailored group trips for corporate customers. 
“We have significantly increased resource and support in our group reservations team, who can load and amend all bookings while you build the relationship with your client and control the margin you make. Ultimately your client gets a unique level of service they wouldn’t get from another TMC.” 
Hughes also revealed future enhancements to the company’s groups department, including dedicated branding and marketing for this area of the business, and offering agents further ability to package group bookings under the company’s in-house packaging system.
